glsa.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Opera contains multiple vulnerabilities, which may allow the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.

description.p: Michael A. Puls II discovered an unspecified flaw when launching external email or newsgroup clients (CVE-2007-5541). David Bloom discovered that when displaying frames from different websites, the same-origin policy is not correctly enforced (CVE-2007-5540).

impact.p: An attacker could potentially exploit the first vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Opera by enticing a user to visit a specially crafted URL. Note that this vulnerability requires an external e-mail or newsgroup client configured in Opera to be exploitable. The second vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a user's browser session in context of other sites or the theft of browser credentials.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time for all these vulnerabilities.

resolution.p: All Opera users should upgrade to the latest version:
